result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric D Bass was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Eric D Bass is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Eric D Bass was found guilty of Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Eric D Bass was found guilty of Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Eric D Bass was found guilty of 1st Deg. Sexual Assault/Aided by Others [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(1)(c).
  • Eric D Bass was found guilty of 1st Deg. Sexual Assault/Aided by Others [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(1)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Commencing forthwith. Concur to ct 2.  Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.

$528  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Defendant not to use or possess any weapon.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with victims or their families or KH, DM, MT, DM or EN.

Sex Offender Registry Required.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
